pageTitle: riceowls.com Daniela Trigo Bio - Rice University Official Athletic Site Rice University Official Athletic Site - Women's Tennis
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {5500=05/08/2013, 2956=2012-13 (Senior) Stalwart for the Owls as part of the No. 3 Doubles team, posting an overall 15-4 record (14-4 at No. 3) with Solomiya Zinko...Duo closed strongly, winning nine of their last 11 matches, including two of three at the C-USA Championship...Provided the key doubles point in the C-USA Championship match, responding after seeing a 6-2 lead dissolve into a 6-6 tie, winning 8-6...Posted a 2-6 mark in singles and a 2-4 mark in doubles in the Fall... Reached the semis of her flight at the Fall Cougar Invite with a win over Liberty's Nicola Wellman... Teamed with Kimberly Anicete to reach the finals of their flight at the Rice Fall Invite with wins over Katarina Dikosavljev and Giada D'ortona of UTA and Kaysie Hermsdorf and Laura Mongin of Abilene Christian., 6133=04/20/2013, 717=High School/Juniors Graduated from Saint Andrew's School in La Paz, Bolivia.. Coached by her late father, Juan Carlos Trigo... Represented Bolivia in the Fed Cup (2006-07-08-09 ) and has a career singles mark of 9-6 in the competition (2-2 in 2009)... ITF Junior career best rank was 388th... Ranked #1 in Bolivia at ages 12, 14, 16 and 18... Ranked second by COSAT (South American Tennis Confederation) at ages 14 and 16..., 3799=Women's tennis defeated Lamar 7-0 on January 20, 6560=05/10/2013, 4231=01/21/2012, 6755=05/11/2013, 6350=04/21/2013, 3962=01/20/2012, 4054=Rice defeated Louisiana-Lafayette, 7-0 on January 21., 5898=04/19/2013, 4451=10/09/2012, 1750=2010-11 Season (Sophomore) Combined with Jessica Jackson for a sterling 18-3 record in doubles and a 5-9 mark in singles play (2-1 @No. 4 and 3-8 @No. 5)... Posted a 9-3 singles record and added a 6-3 mark in doubles... Won the Rice Invite Flight 4 singles title... Teammed with Kimberly Anicete to capture the Flight 3 doubles title at the same event... Advanced to the round of 16 in singles at the USTA-ITA Regionals in Waco., 1293=2009-10 Season (Freshman) Trigo enrolled at Rice at the semester break... Posted a 12-6 mark in her first year of competition for the Owls.... Closed out three wins for the Owls, including their win at #72 LSU... Sparked the Owls dramatic comeback vs. #27 VCU, scoring the Owls first point after they fell behind 3-0, but rallied to take a 4-3 win... Posted a 4-0 mark vs. conference opponents during the season... Won seven of her last 10 matches... Teamed with Jessica Jackson to go 4-4 at No. 2 doubles over the final eight matches of the year., 3588=Trigo match by match 2013 /2012 / 2011 / 2010, 264=Personal Daughter of Elba Trigo Beyer and the late Juan Carlos Trigo ... born on April 15, 1991 at La Paz, Bolivia... Sport Management and Economics major with a Business minor., 5056=04/12/2013, 2154=2011-12 (Junior) A fixture in the Owls' lineup in her first two years, but missed most of the season while returning from rehab for an injury.. Saw action in a pair of singles matches in the C-USA Championship... Dropped her first match, but was tied at 11-11 in a tiebreak second set of her match in the finals when Tulsa clinched the crown...Did not see action in the fall., 3078=HONORS AT RICE 2011, 2012, 2013 C-USA Commissioner's Honor Roll 2011 ITA Scholar-Athlete}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {6365=05/20/2015 - Rice senior Natalie Beazant opens her pursuit to become a two-time All-America on Wednesday when she faces Texas' Breaunna Addison in a match..., 8483=04/24/2015 - One week after winning a third consecutive C-USA Championship and five days before the NCAA will announced where their season will continue, the..., 6724=05/12/2015 - Rice senior Natalie Beazant has been named the Texas Region winner of the ITA/Cissie Leary Award for Sportsmanship and will be a finalist for the..., 7065=05/10/2015 - The 28th ranked Rice women's tennis team saw their hopes of denying #9 Baylor the opportunity to advance in the NCAA Championship at their home..., 8841=04/19/2015 - After celebrating their previous three Conference USA championships on foreign courts, the Rice women's tennis team made certain that the inaugural..., 7421=05/09/2015 - After splitting the first 20 games of her singles match, Rice sophomore Katherine Ip summoned one final surge to win the final two games to take a ..., 8127=04/28/2015 - The Rice women's tennis team will return to a familiar script when they open play in the 2015 NCAA Women's Tennis Championship by facing the Tulsa ..., 7767=05/08/2015 - The Rice women's tennis team takes on Tulsa in the opening round of the 2015 NCAA Women's Tennis Championship on Saturday in Waco and for two of...}
textBeforeTable: Personal Daughter of Elba Trigo Beyer and the late Juan Carlos Trigo ... born on April 15, 1991 at La Paz, Bolivia... Sport Management and Economics major with a Business minor. High School/Juniors Graduated from Saint Andrew's School in La Paz, Bolivia.. Coached by her late father, Juan Carlos Trigo... Represented Bolivia in the Fed Cup (2006-07-08-09 ) and has a career singles mark of 9-6 in the competition (2-2 in 2009)... ITF Junior career best rank was 388th... Ranked #1 in Bolivia at ages 12, 14, 16 and 18... Ranked second by COSAT (South American Tennis Confederation) at ages 14 and 16... 2009-10 Season (Freshman) Trigo enrolled at Rice at the semester break... Posted a 12-6 mark in her first year of competition for the Owls.... Closed out three wins for the Owls, including their win at #72 LSU... Sparked the Owls dramatic comeback vs. #27 VCU, scoring the Owls first point after they fell behind 3-0, but rallied to take a 4-3 win... Posted a 4-0 mark vs. conference opponents during the season... Won seven of her last 10 matches... Teamed with Jessica Jackson to go 4-4 at No. 2 doubles over the final eight matches of the year. 2010-11 Season (Sophomore) Combined with Jessica Jackson for a sterling 18-3 record in doubles and a 5-9 mark in singles play (2-1 @No. 4 and 3-8 @No. 5)... Posted a 9-3 singles record and added a 6-3 mark in doubles... Won
